sentence: In his 12-page April 6 “interim” report to Fann, Brnovich stated that his office found “serious vulnerabilities that must be addressed and raises questions about the 2020 election in Arizona.” Those conclusions appear to contradict mainstream news reports claiming Brnovich uncovered “no evidence of mass fraud in Maricopa County 2020 election results.” Although Brnovich reported that chain-of-custody procedures were violated, including by Secretary of State Katie Hobbs (D), Arizona Republic reported, “Attorney general’s report on election in Maricopa County questions procedures, doesn’t allege wrongdoing.” “Our review uncovered multiple violations of ballot transportation procedures,” Brnovich wrote on page 7.
